arabic_full.translation: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the clear Book.

arabic_full.arabic: إنا أنزلناه قرآنا عربيا لعلكم تعقلون ‎﴿٢﴾
arabic_full.translation: Indeed, We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an that you might understand.

arabic_full.arabic: نحن نقص عليك أحسن القصص بما أوحينا إليك هذا القرآن وإن كنت من قبله لمن الغافلين ‎﴿٣﴾
arabic_full.translation: We relate to you the best of stories in what We have revealed to you of this Qur'an although you were, before it, among the unaware.

arabic_full.arabic: إذ قال يوسف لأبيه يا أبت إني رأيت أحد عشر كوكبا والشمس والقمر رأيتهم لي ساجدين ‎﴿٤﴾
arabic_full.translation: [Mention] when Yusuf said to his father, 'O my father, indeed I have seen eleven stars and the sun and the moon; I saw them prostrating to me.'

arabic_full.arabic: قال يا بني لا تقصص رؤياك على إخوتك فيكيدوا لك كيدا إن الشيطان للإنسان عدو مبين ‎﴿٥﴾
arabic_full.translation: He said, 'O my son, do not relate your vision to your brothers or they will contrive against you a plan. Indeed Satan, to man, is a manifest enemy.'

arabic_full.arabic: وكذلك يجتبيك ربك ويعلمك من تأويل الأحاديث ويتم نعمته عليك وعلى آل يعقوب كما أتمها على أبويك من قبل إبراهيم وإسحاق إن ربك عليم حكيم ‎﴿٦﴾
arabic_full.translation: And thus will your Lord choose you and teach you the interpretation of narratives and complete His favor upon you and upon the family of Ya'qub, as He completed it upon your fathers before, Ibrahim and Ishaq. Indeed, your Lord is Knowing and Wise.

arabic_full.arabic: لقد كان في يوسف وإخوته آيات للسائلين ‎﴿٧﴾
arabic_full.translation: Certainly were there in Yusuf and his brothers signs for those who ask.

passage_layers.title: Opening and Introduction to the Story
passage_layers.description: The surah opens with disconnected letters (الر) followed by an affirmation of the Qur'an as a clear Book revealed in Arabic. It introduces the story of Yusuf as 'the best of stories' and transitions to the narrative beginning with Yusuf's dream.

passage_layers.title: Divine Majesty and Prophetic Communication
passage_layers.description: Use of first-person plural (إنا، نحن) emphasizes divine authority and majesty. The contrast between the unaware state of the Prophet before revelation and his reception of the best of stories highlights the transformative power of divine revelation.

passage_layers.title: Father's Wisdom and Warning
passage_layers.description: Ya'qub's response to Yusuf's dream demonstrates wisdom and foresight. He recognizes both the divine favor implicit in the dream and the potential danger from jealous brothers, connecting human nature to Satan's enmity.

passage_layers.title: Prostration of Celestial Bodies
passage_layers.description: The imagery of eleven stars, the sun, and the moon prostrating symbolizes future honor and authority, using metaphorical language common in dream interpretation traditions.

passage_layers.title: Prophetic Lineage and Divine Favor
passage_layers.description: The passage concludes by situating Yusuf within the lineage of prophets (Ibrahim, Ishaq, Ya'qub) and affirming Allah's knowledge and wisdom in choosing and favoring His servants.

reflective: How does the opening of Surah Yusuf establish the authority and purpose of the Qur'an before beginning the narrative?
What does Ya'qub's advice to Yusuf reveal about the relationship between divine favor and human trials?
Reflect on why this is called 'the best of stories.' What qualities might make a narrative 'the best'?
How does the passage connect individual destiny (Yusuf's dream) with family heritage (the lineage of prophets)?
analytical: Analyze the use of first-person plural pronouns (إنا، نحن) in verses 2-3. What rhetorical effect does this create?
Compare and contrast the two instances of رأيت in verse 4. Why does Yusuf repeat this verb?
Examine the structure of verse 6: identify the multiple blessings promised and how they parallel past prophetic experiences.
What is the relationship between the 'clear Book' (الكتاب المبين) in verse 1 and the 'best of stories' (أحسن القصص) in verse 3?
Analyze the warning in verse 5: what grammatical structures convey urgency and caution?

text.arabic: الر تلك آيات الكتاب المبين ‎﴿١﴾‏ إنا أنزلناه قرآنا عربيا لعلكم تعقلون ‎﴿٢﴾‏ نحن نقص عليك أحسن القصص بما أوحينا إليك هذا القرآن وإن كنت من قبله لمن الغافلين ‎﴿٣﴾‏إذ قال يوسف لأبيه يا أبت إني رأيت أحد عشر كوكبا والشمس والقمر رأيتهم لي ساجدين ‎﴿٤﴾‏ قال يا بني لا تقصص رؤياك على إخوتك فيكيدوا لك كيدا إن الشيطان للإنسان عدو مبين ‎﴿٥﴾‏ وكذلك يجتبيك ربك ويعلمك من تأويل الأحاديث ويتم نعمته عليك وعلى آل يعقوب كما أتمها على أبويك من قبل إبراهيم وإسحاق إن ربك عليم حكيم ‎﴿٦﴾‏  لقد كان في يوسف وإخوته آيات للسائلين ‎﴿٧﴾
